title: Track Awesome Cross Platform Nodejs Updates Weekly
_seo_title: Track Awesome Cross Platform Nodejs (bcoe/awesome-cross-platform-nodejs) Updates Weekly - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Cross Platform Nodejs Updates on Apr 29 - May 05, 2019
items.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Apr 29 - May 05, 2019
items.content_text:
### Resources

*   [Writing Cross-Platform Node.js](http://shapeshed.com/writing-cross-platform-node/) - Great tutorial covering many common issues that arise when writing cross-platform code: path creation, script execution, newline characters.

### Applications / Virtualization

*   [Docker](https://www.docker.com/) - Software platform to create, deploy and manage virtualized application containers on a common operating system, with an ecosystem of allied tools.

### Applications / Databases

*   [Redis (⭐9.6k)](https://github.com/tporadowski/redis) - Native port of Redis for Windows.
items.content_html:
Resources

  • Writing Cross-Platform Node.js - Great tutorial covering many common issues that arise when writing cross-platform code: path creation, script execution, newline characters.

Applications / Virtualization

  • Docker - Software platform to create, deploy and manage virtualized application containers on a common operating system, with an ecosystem of allied tools.

Applications / Databases

  • Redis (⭐9.6k) - Native port of Redis for Windows.

items.title: Awesome Cross Platform Nodejs Updates on Apr 22 - Apr 28, 2019
items.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Apr 22 - Apr 28, 2019
items.content_text:
### Known issues / Windows registry

*   [cmd.exe unicode woes (⭐34k)](https://github.com/nodejs/node-v0.x-archive/issues/7940) - By default, `cmd.exe` does not display Unicode characters on Windows.
*   [exec() behavior between shells (⭐38)](https://github.com/isaacs/spawn-wrap#contracts-and-caveats) - Depending on the shell being used, e.g., bash vs. dash, `child_process.exec()` has inconsistent exit behavior.

### See also / Windows registry

*   [awesome-desktop-js (⭐840)](https://github.com/styfle/awesome-desktop-js) - List of tools to build JavaScript applications on the desktop.
items.content_html:
Known issues / Windows registry

  • cmd.exe unicode woes (⭐34k) - By default, cmd.exe does not display Unicode characters on Windows.
  • exec() behavior between shells (⭐38) - Depending on the shell being used, e.g., bash vs. dash, child_process.exec() has inconsistent exit behavior.

See also / Windows registry

  • awesome-desktop-js (⭐840) - List of tools to build JavaScript applications on the desktop.

items.title: Awesome Cross Platform Nodejs Updates on Apr 15 - Apr 21, 2019
items.summary: 4 awesome projects updated on Apr 15 - Apr 21, 2019
items.content_text:
### Applications / Development environment

*   [nvm (⭐86k)](https://github.com/creationix/nvm) / [n (⭐19k)](https://github.com/tj/n) - Node version manager for macOS/Linux.

### Applications / Continuous integration

*   [Azure Pipelines](https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/devops/pipelines/) - Windows/macOS/Linux. Free for OSS projects with 10 parallel jobs.

### Libraries / Signals

*   [fkill (⭐739)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/fkill) - Kill processes. Cross-platform.

### Libraries / Windows registry

*   [windows-registry-node (⭐116)](https://github.com/CatalystCode/windows-registry-node) - Access/modify the Windows registry and set file associations.
items.content_html:
Applications / Development environment

Applications / Continuous integration

Libraries / Signals

  • fkill (⭐739) - Kill processes. Cross-platform.

Libraries / Windows registry

  • windows-registry-node (⭐116) - Access/modify the Windows registry and set file associations.

items.title: Awesome Cross Platform Nodejs Updates on Apr 08 - Apr 14, 2019
items.summary: 41 awesome projects updated on Apr 08 - Apr 14, 2019
items.content_text:
### Resources

*   [Core Node.js documentation](https://nodejs.org/en/docs/) - Especially the [`os`](https://nodejs.org/api/os.html), [`path`](https://nodejs.org/api/path.html), [`fs`](https://nodejs.org/api/fs.html), [`process`](https://nodejs.org/api/process.html) and [`child_process`](https://nodejs.org/api/child_process.html) modules.
*   [Cross-platform Node.js guide (⭐1.4k)](https://github.com/ehmicky/cross-platform-node-guide) - How to write cross-platform Node.js code.

### Applications / Development environment

*   [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/download/) - Node.js installer for various platforms.
*   [nvm-windows (⭐42k)](https://github.com/coreybutler/nvm-windows) - Manage multiple installations of Node.js on a Windows computer.
*   [npm-windows-upgrade (⭐2.5k)](https://github.com/felixrieseberg/npm-windows-upgrade) - Upgrade npm on Windows.
*   [windows-build-tools (⭐3.4k)](https://github.com/felixrieseberg/windows-build-tools) - Install C++ Build Tools for Windows using npm.

### Applications / Continuous integration

*   [AppVeyor](http://www.appveyor.com/) - Focused on Windows. Free tiers are available for OSS projects.
*   [Travis](https://travis-ci.org/) - Windows/macOS/Linux. Free for OSS projects.

### Applications / Virtualization

*   [ievms (⭐68)](https://github.com/amichaelparker/ievms) - Automated installer for the free virtual machine images that Microsoft provides for testing on multiple versions of IE. These images can be useful for cross-platform testing various technologies, however make sure you read and understand Microsofts' licensing.

### Applications / Compatibility

*   [Wine](https://www.winehq.org/) - Run Windows API calls on Linux, Mac, BSD and Solaris.
*   [Cygwin](https://www.cygwin.com/) - Run POSIX on Windows.
*   [WSL](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install-win10) - Run the Linux command line on Windows (ELF binary execution, system calls, filesystem, Bash, core utilities, common applications).
*   [MinGW](http://www.mingw.org/) - `gcc` on Windows.
*   [msys](http://www.mingw.org/wiki/msys) / [Git Bash](https://gitforwindows.org/) - Bash on Windows.

### Libraries / OS identification

*   [is-wsl (⭐190)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/is-wsl) - Detect whether current platform is WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux).
*   [getos (⭐79)](https://github.com/retrohacker/getos) - Retrieve the current OS, including Linux distribution.
*   [os-name (⭐147)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/os-name) - Get the name of the current operating system.
*   [systeminformation (⭐2.9k)](https://github.com/sebhildebrandt/systeminformation) - Hardware/software system information.

### Libraries / Shell

*   [cross-spawn (⭐1.1k)](https://github.com/IndigoUnited/node-cross-spawn) - Cross-platform implementation of `child_process.spawn()`.
*   [shelljs (⭐14k)](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs) - Cross-platform Unix shell commands.
*   [node-windows (⭐2.9k)](https://github.com/coreybutler/node-windows) - Windows support for Node.js scripts (daemons, eventlog, UAC, etc).
*   [clipboardy (⭐1.8k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/clipboardy) / [clipboard-cli (⭐501)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/clipboard-cli) - Cross-platform copy/paste.

### Libraries / Environment

*   [cross-env (⭐6.4k)](https://github.com/kentcdodds/cross-env) - Set environment variables cross-platform.
*   [user-home (⭐160)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/user-home) - Get the path to the user home directory. Cross-platform.
*   [username (⭐143)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/username) - Get the current username.
*   [osenv (⭐137)](https://github.com/npm/osenv) - Cross-platform environment variables.
*   [is-elevated (⭐41)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/is-elevated) - Check if the process is running with elevated privileges.
*   [which (⭐339)](https://github.com/npm/node-which) - Cross-platform implementation of Unix's `which`.

### Libraries / Filesystem

*   [rimraf (⭐5.8k)](https://github.com/isaacs/rimraf) / [del (⭐1.3k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/del) - Delete files and folders. Cross-platform.
*   [make-dir (⭐478)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/make-dir) - Cross-platform `mkdir -p`.
*   [readdirp (⭐387)](https://github.com/paulmillr/readdirp) - Recursive version of `fs.readdir()`.
*   [graceful-fs (⭐1.3k)](https://github.com/isaacs/node-graceful-fs) - Improves the `fs` module, especially on Windows.
*   [any-path (⭐4)](https://github.com/bcoe/any-path) - Use Windows and POSIX paths interchangeably when fetching values from an object.

### Libraries / Signals

*   [signal-exit (⭐192)](https://github.com/tapjs/signal-exit) - Cross-platform `exit` handler.

### Libraries / Processes

*   [ps-list (⭐276)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/ps-list) - Get running processes.
*   [process-exists (⭐58)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/process-exists) - Check if a process exists.

### Libraries / Desktop UI

*   [open (⭐3.3k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/open) - Opens stuff like websites, files, executables. Cross-platform.
*   [node-notifier (⭐5.8k)](https://github.com/mikaelbr/node-notifier) - Cross-platform desktop notifications.

### Libraries / Windows registry

*   [node-winreg (⭐213)](https://github.com/fresc81/node-winreg) - Access the Windows registry.
*   [rage-edit (⭐54)](https://github.com/MikeKovarik/rage-edit) - Access/modify the Windows registry.

### Known issues / Windows registry

*   [spawn issues (⭐34k)](https://github.com/nodejs/node-v0.x-archive/issues/2318) - `child_process.spawn()` behavior is not consistent between Windows and Linux.
items.content_html:
Resources

  • Core Node.js documentation - Especially the os, path, fs, process and child_process modules.
  • Cross-platform Node.js guide (⭐1.4k) - How to write cross-platform Node.js code.

Applications / Development environment

  • Node.js - Node.js installer for various platforms.
  • nvm-windows (⭐42k) - Manage multiple installations of Node.js on a Windows computer.
  • npm-windows-upgrade (⭐2.5k) - Upgrade npm on Windows.
  • windows-build-tools (⭐3.4k) - Install C++ Build Tools for Windows using npm.

Applications / Continuous integration

  • AppVeyor - Focused on Windows. Free tiers are available for OSS projects.
  • Travis - Windows/macOS/Linux. Free for OSS projects.

Applications / Virtualization

  • ievms (⭐68) - Automated installer for the free virtual machine images that Microsoft provides for testing on multiple versions of IE. These images can be useful for cross-platform testing various technologies, however make sure you read and understand Microsofts' licensing.

Applications / Compatibility

  • Wine - Run Windows API calls on Linux, Mac, BSD and Solaris.
  • Cygwin - Run POSIX on Windows.
  • WSL - Run the Linux command line on Windows (ELF binary execution, system calls, filesystem, Bash, core utilities, common applications).
  • MinGW - gcc on Windows.
  • msys / Git Bash - Bash on Windows.

Libraries / OS identification

  • is-wsl (⭐190) - Detect whether current platform is WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux).
  • getos (⭐79) - Retrieve the current OS, including Linux distribution.
  • os-name (⭐147) - Get the name of the current operating system.
  • systeminformation (⭐2.9k) - Hardware/software system information.

Libraries / Shell

  • cross-spawn (⭐1.1k) - Cross-platform implementation of child_process.spawn().
  • shelljs (⭐14k) - Cross-platform Unix shell commands.
  • node-windows (⭐2.9k) - Windows support for Node.js scripts (daemons, eventlog, UAC, etc).
  • clipboardy (⭐1.8k) / clipboard-cli (⭐501) - Cross-platform copy/paste.

Libraries / Environment

  • cross-env (⭐6.4k) - Set environment variables cross-platform.
  • user-home (⭐160) - Get the path to the user home directory. Cross-platform.
  • username (⭐143) - Get the current username.
  • osenv (⭐137) - Cross-platform environment variables.
  • is-elevated (⭐41) - Check if the process is running with elevated privileges.
  • which (⭐339) - Cross-platform implementation of Unix's which.

Libraries / Filesystem

  • rimraf (⭐5.8k) / del (⭐1.3k) - Delete files and folders. Cross-platform.
  • make-dir (⭐478) - Cross-platform mkdir -p.
  • readdirp (⭐387) - Recursive version of fs.readdir().
  • graceful-fs (⭐1.3k) - Improves the fs module, especially on Windows.
  • any-path (⭐4) - Use Windows and POSIX paths interchangeably when fetching values from an object.

Libraries / Signals

  • signal-exit (⭐192) - Cross-platform exit handler.

Libraries / Processes

  • ps-list (⭐276) - Get running processes.
  • process-exists (⭐58) - Check if a process exists.

Libraries / Desktop UI

  • open (⭐3.3k) - Opens stuff like websites, files, executables. Cross-platform.
  • node-notifier (⭐5.8k) - Cross-platform desktop notifications.

Libraries / Windows registry

  • node-winreg (⭐213) - Access the Windows registry.
  • rage-edit (⭐54) - Access/modify the Windows registry.

Known issues / Windows registry

  • spawn issues (⭐34k) - child_process.spawn() behavior is not consistent between Windows and Linux.

items.title: Awesome Cross Platform Nodejs Updates on Dec 28 - Jan 03, 2015
items.summary: 8 awesome projects updated on Dec 28 - Jan 03, 2015
items.content_text:
### Resources

*   [Microsoft Node.js Guidelines (⭐2.5k)](https://github.com/Microsoft/nodejs-guidelines) - Tips, tricks, and resources for working with Node.js on Microsoft platforms.

### Applications / Virtualization

*   [VirtualBox](https://www.virtualbox.org/wiki/Downloads) - General purpose software for running x86 virtual machines.

### Libraries / OS identification

*   [is-windows (⭐48)](https://github.com/jonschlinkert/is-windows) - Detect whether the current platform is Windows.

### Libraries / Shell

*   [execa (⭐7.2k)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/execa) - Cross-platform implementation of `child_process.{execFile,exec}`.
*   [log-symbols (⭐757)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/log-symbols) - Colored symbols for various log levels with Windows fallbacks.
*   [figures (⭐605)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/figures) - Unicode symbols with Windows fallbacks.

### Libraries / Filesystem

*   [cpy (⭐429)](https://github.com/sindresorhus/cpy) - Copy files. Cross-platform.
*   [chokidar (⭐11k)](https://github.com/paulmillr/chokidar) - Improved cross-platform file watching.
items.content_html:
Resources

  • Microsoft Node.js Guidelines (⭐2.5k) - Tips, tricks, and resources for working with Node.js on Microsoft platforms.

Applications / Virtualization

  • VirtualBox - General purpose software for running x86 virtual machines.

Libraries / OS identification

  • is-windows (⭐48) - Detect whether the current platform is Windows.

Libraries / Shell

  • execa (⭐7.2k) - Cross-platform implementation of child_process.{execFile,exec}.
  • log-symbols (⭐757) - Colored symbols for various log levels with Windows fallbacks.
  • figures (⭐605) - Unicode symbols with Windows fallbacks.

Libraries / Filesystem

  • cpy (⭐429) - Copy files. Cross-platform.
  • chokidar (⭐11k) - Improved cross-platform file watching.
